intro: Cola proteiformis, commonly known as the variable cola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to western Africa, where it grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Cola proteiformis make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
